html:
11.14.23  1:18 am   How many takes do you average when tracking final instrumental parts on your songs?

     With the nature of your production and arrangements, I assume you're tracking parts section by section.

     When you are tracking those 8 bars of bass or a 2 bar keys flourish or an ornamental synth stab, how many cracks do you take at it?

     Do you nail down the idea and practice it until it's clean enough, or take multiple improvised variation takes until it feels good?

     Do you have an order you prefer to track instruments in?
original_html:
11.14.23  1:18 am   How many takes do you average when tracking final instrumental parts on your songs?

html: 11.13.23  6:50 pm   hi bill. any tips on finishing songs? i have, no joke, over 3 whole albums worth of ideas, wether it be lyrics, chord progressions, melodies, structures, etc. but i've never actually written a full song. it's very frustrating because most of the ideas, in my opinion, are very good, but i just can't seem to find the motivation to actually focus and finish a song (writing lyrics in particular is very difficult for me). any tips to combat this? and have you ever been in this situation?

html:
11.13.23  3:12 pm   i'm currently alternating between working a full-time job and being in university, both entirely unrelated to music. i have a fair amount of free time which i try to spend as much as possible on music. some days i feel like this situation is pretty good, but other days i feel like i am travelling down the completely wrong path, because i'm basically wasting enormous amounts of time on non-music. and when i look at all these professional musicians most of them went to music school instead of not-music school, and they got jobs related to music of course.

     and i'm scared that if i continue what i'm doing then i'm going to get "locked out" of the music world because i won't be good enough, or i won't know anybody, or something. what do i do??
original_html:

html:
11.13.23  10:33 am   I've always thought that "At the Airport Terminal" was one of your most emotional songs, but I've never been able to make heads or tails of the "porridge" line. Does it represent something? Or is there for the equally noble purpose of just sounding cool?


3.8.22 8:08 pm
3.23.21 4:44 am
2.17.21 7:40 am
1.21.21 10:15 pm
11.15.20 5:22 am
10.2.20 9:50 pm
8.18.20 6:30 am
8.17.20 12:51 am
5.16.20 8:52 am
2.7.20 10:43 pm
10.30.19 11:48 am
embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202203082008

3.8.22  8:08 pm   In the airport terminal, did you actually heT PORRIDGE FOR THE WRONG AMOUNT OF TIME?

      no, what i did was i embarked into writing a bridge section which i thought took some interesting turns but instead it got me backed into a corner i didn't want to go to and couldn't get out of. so i removed that part, went back to the point before it did that, and then used one of my standard tricks which is: express how i feel about how the writing process is going, in the writing


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202103230444

3.23.21  4:44 am   in your song 'at the airport terminal,' is the line "and i'm eating porridge but i've heated it for the wrong amount of time" an allegory?

     i'm not sure what allegory means, but i think yes

     if yes, what do you actually mean by it? 

     that bridge section was getting ...... lost and useless, and it just wasn't re-connecting back to main section. so i chopped off a few bars and replaced it with the porridge part. which seems to be a metaphor for losing track of the time


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202102170740

2.17.21  7:40 am   what was the inspiration behind "i'm eating porridge but i've heated it for the wrong amount of time"?

     the bridge section was in danger of losing momentum and getting weak and lost. So i did what any responsible adventurer would do. confess my sins and move along

      actually what was the inspiration behind all of "at the airport terminal"?

     the inspiration for the first line and main melody was just based on a warm pleasant feeling of traveling through an airport terminal. Then, each moment after is inspired by the previous moments in the song so far


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202101212215

1.21.21  10:15 pm   In At the Airport Terminal, was your porridge overcooked? Or undercooked?

      it was for too much time, but a too low power setting. so i'm not sure


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202011150522

11.15.20  5:22 am   did you ever get the heating time of your porridge right?

      not yet


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202010022150

10.2.20  9:50 pm   In "at the airport terminal", did you overcook or undercook your porridge in the microwave?

      it was not porridge, it was the previous section of the song. and i heated it for too much time, but also at a too low temperature


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202008180630

8.18.20  6:30 am   'at the airport terminal' is such an inspirational song to me, i must ask how long you heated your porridge

      in that context, it was impossible to determine exactly, all i knew is that it was wrong. And what i think i really meant by that, in context, is that when i was writing that section it was starting to turn out not good (bad). so the only way to cope was to back up about 4 bars, then confess it succinctly and move on


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202008170051

8.17.20  12:51 am   when you said "and I'm eating porridge but I've heated it for the wrong amount of time" in At the Airport Terminal was it to cold or to hot?

      not cold enough to be cold, not hot enough to be hot. too medium


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202005160852

5.16.20  8:52 am   Why did you add "And i'm eating porridge but i've heated it for the wrong amount of time"?

      because it was better than what i had there before. actually, now that i go back and check, it seems like the porridge line is a good metaphor for what was going wrong with the previous solution i had there


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=202002072243b

2.7.20  10:43 pm   what happened to the porridge you heated for the wrong amount of time?

     absolutely nothing


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201910301148

10.30.19  11:48 am   In your song 'In the Airport Terminal', how long did you heat your porridge for?

     long enough to escape from the bridge
